section.name: Joda Money
section.p: Joda-Money provides a library of classes to store amounts of money.

Joda-Money does not provide, nor is it intended to provide, monetary algorithms beyond the most basic and obvious. This is because the requirements for these algorithms vary widely between domains. This library is intended to act as the base layer, providing classes that should be in the JDK.
Users are reminded that this software, like all open source software, is provided on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND.

Version 0.5 was released on 2008-11-17 - Download now

section.name: Releases
section.p: There are no full releases yet! Release 0.5 is the current development release intended for feedback rather than production use. (The code is fully tested, but there may yet be bugs and the API may yet change).

There are no runtime dependencies beyond JDK 1.5.
(Joda-Money has a compile-time dependency on Joda-Convert, but this is not required at runtime)

section.name: Support
section.p: Support on bugs, library usage or enhancement requests is available on a best efforts basis via:
